Generation IV.Diamond: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
Generation IV.Pearl: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.

Generation V.Black: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
Generation V.White: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
Generation V.Black 2: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
Generation V.White 2: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.

Generation VI.X: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
Generation VI.Y: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.

Generation VII.Sun: Many fossils of this Pokémon have been found, but almost none have shown signs of damage to the face.
Generation VII.Moon: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it's thought.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it has no particular need to battle with others and can spend its time feeding on grass and berries.
Generation IX.Violet: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. It’s thought that Shieldon had few enemies thanks to its sturdy face.

Generation IV.Diamond: Trade Receive Armor Fossil held by a traded Pokémon and revive it
Generation IV.Pearl: Revive from Armor Fossil at the Oreburgh Mining Museum in Oreburgh City
